review_title: B&S or gorn? Here’s my opinion
one_reviews_text:
If you’re looking for buying blade and sorcery or gorn I would recommend a lot more gorn,I had blade and sorcery and you read it correct I had it, I refund it because I found it really boring, really repetitive and well b&s feels more violent but it’s way more boring and repetitive, in B&S you choose the level and play different type of modes ( if I’m honest the “different modes”are all the same s**t)
Next let me say my opinion about gorn:
 it’s really fun and really immersive for real( I have hit the walls with my hands just trying to kill someone) the levels may look repetitive but you get and get more weapons of different types and also when you finish one floor they appear different bosses, the map changes and also the enemies , even if you finish the game you got the totally customizable level, or you just can play the game again at it’s not boring at all.
I think this is all about personal preference but I had B&S and have gorn and I would totally prefer gorn over B&S but my true recommendation is to try both and see what you like the most.

Mutilation has never been so fun! Theres honestly not much to say about this game exept for, its fun. The enemies are fun to fight and the armor system adds some welcome complexity to viciously extracting their organs with swords, maces, spears and a variety of other weapons. The artstyle adds a nice layer of charm and makes the immense violence more fun than horrifying. I only really have one nitpick, i just wish some weapons were a little less floppy but honestly, the floppy weapons add more to the fun than they take away in mose cases. I am exited for any new content.

Pros:
+insane, fun gameplay
+doesnt take itself too seriously
+interesting art style

Cons:
-I only slightly dislike the floppy weapons
-I kinda just wish there was more

Overall gorn is pretty great and deftinately worth a buy.

review_title: Really just not a good game
one_reviews_text: I had spent weeks on this game and had 20 hours of work put into it.  Then I went in and saw that my game had completely reset.     Edit: Ok.  That last part is true, but here is my full review:  This game is incredibly unfinished.  I mean, it released and everything, but it is not even close to being called a game.  The reason I had 20 hours in the game before is because I played for 6 hours at a time not progressing.  At most, expect maaaybe 8 hours for the story.  And the final misson *SPOILER ALERT*  is one big dogs*** pile.  The final mission never saves, and they decided to add this ramdom mechanic for health, which doesn't make you feel like a bad***, it makes you feel like a man dangling off of a cliff with his pinky, bound to die at any moment.  Every single mission leading up to it is easy as cake.  I believe that the devs wanted you to feel like an unstoppable force, but it just feels like you are fighting infants with an LMG.  Not much 'Bad***' in that.

review_title: I love every second of playing this game
one_reviews_text:
It is extremely immersive, and yes, while there are tracking issues (sometimes) all the mechanics work flawlessly, i am genuenly concerned that this game is turning me into a serial killer by this point. I was strolling in the park the other day and i saw a guy with a toolbox fixing a lampost and i saw a hammer inside his toolbox... my mind instantly went "oh this would be a great tool for bashing someone's skull in". I was playing and I went controller first into my PC monitor which i haven't even gotten remotely close to doing with other games like arizona sunshine or budget cuts. This game is pretty much the VR alternative to a stress ball and it just works as a college student, waking up, making ramen, and letting stress override you for your whole crappy monday just to get to play this game at the end of the day and realise "wow, i'd really make for a good Ted Bundy when stress is all on me". 10/10 recommended, oh and you can impale opponents and leave them to hang impaled from the big arena walls.



*UPDATE* this game is extremely gory, I mean if you didnt already know that why are you still here? But in case you are a small itty bitty child there is a low gore mode in which candy flies out of your opponents when you rip their heads off. Fun game for the whole family. My grandpa almost fainted from the physical effort he put in for christmas at out party when he played this game.
It’s mindless fun and I would recommend this game. My only problem is the weird movement, like how you have to drag yourself, but I guess it adds to the goofyness
I never authorized the purchase of this game and not only will Oculus not give me a refund  but they have locked me out of their system to request refunds for any reason? Be advised.

Using weapons can be a bit clunky at times, and yeah, theres a few glitches and bugs to iron out, but honestly, they could ship this as a final release product today and I would gladly still pay the current price for it. or any price for that matter. It's that fun, and I can't reccomend it enough

Great physics engine and nicely presented overall experience with a large amount of customization options for sandbox play.  Despite that, the lackluster AI and lack of overall content keep the game from being something to play for more than a few hours or once every now and then.  Adding lots more progression content (currently 3 floors, needs several more if they go this route), converting the game into a fun gladiator management sim where you can participate, or just adding better local multiplayer (better control as the non-VR player, etc.) - any of these 3 routes or I'm sure other ideas would give the game some "legs".  Currently, it is more along the lines of a very impressive tech demo.  Still overall give it a slight recommend, catch it on sale and keep an eye for updates.

review_title: February update made this game unplayabl
one_reviews_text: This game went from very fun to very not fun. Lost all progress with latest update and there are many, many bugs. Go to main menu with right touch controller - FREEZES half the time, one controller doesn't work the other half and need to reset game. Log out - All progress lost. Traditional using weapons - weapon swing gets glitchy, tracking is lost, weapon dissappears and swing arc doesn't work correctly. Also either the game dynamics were modified or the tracking algorithm was changed because the weight of swinging weapons doesn't work correctly anymore and now I can only use wrist movements, not whole arm movements, otherwise the weapon blurs/dissappears/doesnt hit the baddie.  PLEASE FIX. I'd love to start playing again but in current state, it's acting like an alpha test.  My computer has no problem running any VR game I've got, so it's not a graphics card problem.

This game is by far the best vr game I have ever played! I love the movement and allmost every thing about it, the only thing that I would like to change is add more levels. I beat them all in less than a day. Also there is this glitch where on the arenas with the pits, you can walk along the pit and everyone will just walk right in and kill them selves when they are coming for you. But others than that this is a amazing game and I would definitely recommend it to anyone with a someone decent computer. Like I have a i5 1060 and 8gb of ram and it runs allmost perfect. It’s just that sometimes there is a little bit of blur that appears when I turn some times but I’m pretty shure that’s my pc.
i just beat the whole game in one session so im relly worn out. also the reason your games are going black is because your pc probly has low stats.

I love this game, I can spend more time in it than any other game I have for the rift. My only issue with it is the lag, getting towards the end of a match the framerate drops so low that it gets unplayable. This only occurs when there are tons of body parts laying and flying around though and until I upgrade my gpu to at least minimum spec I can't really blame this on the developer, thus I am still giving it 5 stars. I only wish there were more adjustable graphics options, like max body parts, max physics objects, blood splatters, etc. Then it could be more accessable for lower end rigs. Although even now I can play with no issues in the arena mode. I only have issues when I get 50+ kills in endless. Anyway, thank you for this amazing game!

wow was this game a huge disapointment. There are two methods of character movement in this game. Thw default one where you swing your arms to move is incredibly slow and clunky. The other option is smooth movement with the thumb sticks. Which is much better but gave me motion sickness instantly. You will have enemies constantly coming at you from all sides which is dizzying. The combat system is very clu ky too. picking up weapons and holding they is way more difficult than it should be. Watch some videos and you will see the weapons bend like they are made out of rubber and most of the time you pickup a weapon you end up holding it all wrong. upside down or even backwords. I get this game is early access but it is pretty much unplayable in this state. Complete waste of $15. I cant believe some reviews are saying this is the best combat or game oculus has to offer. Maybe this is the only one they have tried.

I started playing Friday night around 10. With all my physical strength drained, I gathered all the mental strength I could and pulled the headset off my sweaty face, it was 4AM! Well done guys!
The movement: Yes, it's a bit wonky at first but with a little patience I got used to it, and with a few selections I was able to modify them to my liking. An insult*? FFS get a grip.
The gameplay: Love it, the warriors rolling around like "retarded monkeys*" is what makes the game for me. I lose it so hard sometimes I actually get creamed by a warrior I didn't spot. This game is hilarious to play and at the same time I'm able to feed my aggro side. It's almost like being a hybrid of the Joker and Wolverine. 
Changing the blood and gore setting to nonviolence is brilliant. Instead of chopping and smashing the "retarded monkeys" I get to smack them around until I see some lollipops! I hate having a game that I can't share with my kiddos, with that setting alone I can. Thanks for making that option available.
Great game Freelives!

*From a previous reviewer who obviously lacks a sense of humor and patience. Get a grip, it's not Skyrim.

First the positives:

I really like the concept. I like the idea itself. I like the crowd of heads. The animation style. The weapons. The gore. The PVP and Solo games. I like that you can put your hands up to signal end and begin like you would if you've won any battle. I like the option controls in the lobby room. The levers. Even the movement is kind of cute, dragging yourself around like an ape though I turned this off because it's slow... It's all really going to be neat. All that gets 4 stars but would get 5 if...

Ok I realize this is a pre-release beta situation. So that's why I'm giving it a lot of passes on this stuff because I hope they improve all this.

First off, this game should cater to the Oculus Touch. I don't think they have a handle on those even if it says that's what it's for.   

1. The grasping of things is just plain buggy and broken. It sometimes gets reversed where pressing the grip and trigger buttons opens the hand and letting go closes them, or grasping a weapon is backwards.  
2. Grabbing weapons or levers is really badly tracked because I can aim for the mace handle but it just won't grasp it and pick it up. It takes several tries despite being right on target.  
3. Your own arms and hands are invisible, hands only sometimes, like when you're grasping a weapon. I think it should show everything, like Lone Echo, Vox Machinae and other games do. As cartoonish as this game is, the immersion would be better.
4. Punching rarely works. I can be a perfect aim but it won't register that I've punched the guy in the face repeatedly. 
5. I figured out that if I get hit once, I'm out unless I knock them out before losing consciousness. This seems odd to me, because it doesn't happen to the opponents, but maybe it's only part of the AI solo games.
6. The match starts slow. I see the typing on the chart that unrolls but it'll just sit there for a while and then finally continue. Speaking of the typed text on the scroll, voiceovers would be better.
Game does not load, please help!

There's a few bugs here and there, but the game is long and extremely fun. You feel very powerful beating down on your opponents and there's a wide array of different strategies and combat styles to utilize and fight against.
Unlocked everything the first day I got it, played it nonstop, couldn't sleep so I got out of bed to write this. Just get the game, it's amazing and 100% worth 20 bucks

I love the gameplay and trhill of this game, and I only really have 2 complaints. One is the lack of guidance, because it took me a while to figure everything out, when they couldve easily explained all the mechanics, and the other is this annoying bug yhat ive been coming across recently. That bug is that almost every time I hit the Oculus button on the right touch controller, whether it be on purpose or by accident, the game crashes. This has gotten very annoying, and hope its fixed soon.
review_feedback: Hey, I believe that that crash issue is fixed now, sorry for the inconvenience!

one_reviews_text: This 'game' is utterly pointless with next to zero learning curve and basically one environment. That said, for some reason it stays entertaining for hours figuring out different ways to slice and dice the incompetent baddies.... really stupid and yet really fun. $20? Not sure... but I did play it for a couple hours straight after purchasing and I will definitely be back for some blowing off steam in the future.

review_title: Small Space? No Worries!(w/Note to Devs)
one_reviews_text:
When I first tried Gorn it was last year on the Steam version, however I had a much larger (Garage Sized) play space so it was easy to get lost in the game without fear of hitting anything, fast forward to today and ive moved and my play space is significantly smaller, it is the "Optimal Size" according to Oculus, however I have 2 counters on both left and right from me so I cant really venture out of my Chaperone boundries to much, which for most games is not a problem, this game however I was so worried based on my previous time playing it that It would be a major issue over head swinging just to smash my hand right into the counter.

NOPE NOT AT ALL! The developers have done an ABSOLUTELY AMAZING job accomodating small play spaces, with both the ability to walk and rotate with the controllers joysticks I can literally go all out in game without needing to move much at all in the real world, having a smaller space has not dappend my experiance. And also that ability to turn on "Strict Chaperone" is also a highly appreciated feature, as anyone who has played Gorn knows, when you get in the zone, your IN THE Zone lol, so to have the game pause if you reach out of the play space, only resuming after a breif countdown when your back in, is amazing!

NOTE TO DEVELOPERS: All that being said, the 1 things that I would love to see as it would make the experiance even better, would be to have the ability to adjust the quick turn radius when using the joysticks, currently its set to a default number (which feels like it may be 45deg, im not sure), however having a slightly smaller turn radious option would be very welcomed!

Love the game, this is my GO TO party game when I have company!

I don't really know what I should say, but I'll say this. The immersion on this game is at the level where my sister, the sweetest and most kind person I know, turns into a vicious killing machine who rips out the enemies hearts and rips out their limbs.

10/10 would buy again.

I have had a TON of fun with this game, the only problem i have is that the fists are unaligned with my hands .3. i dont know if thats normal but its still playable. i agree with some reviews that the movement is kinda crappy but it is changeable so it all comes down to your preference. There are tons of weapons to choose from and tons of champions to beat and once you have finished beating the champions you can go to the custom game and mess about with that, for example i like to increase the knockback and damage and turn into one punch man :) Definetly worth the money if it seems like your kind of game

This game has been nothing but fun for me but their is one bug I have come across, everytime I press the Oculus home button on the right controller the game will crash. The game will also crash if I take my headset off and put it back on. Other then this bug the game is great and the movement can be clanky but i have gotten ussed to it. You can also switch the movement type in the game to the joysticks whoch are a lot smoother to use.
review_feedback: Hey, I believe that that crash issue is fixed now, sorry for the inconvenience!

one_reviews_text: Half an hour of this superb game a day makes a  difference to the lazy gamer .I have lost 3lbs this week from playing Gorn. Plus you can live out your Wolverine fantasies when you unlock the claws.

If you're in the mood for senseless violence and copious amounts of gore, this is perfect.  The controls are intuitive, gameplay is smooth (mostly), and its funny af watching people play.  The game still needs music in the arena, other than that, great game.

This has turned into my goto oculus game whenever I need to release some stress, get a vr work out, laugh or simply have fun. Its more polished than most of the games I've played in VR and it makes you want to come back for more. A word of warning though...Know where you are in your room. You could potentially destroy something or yourself.

review_title: Very buggy and a bit booring
one_reviews_text:
The default locomotion, which is swinging your arms while pressing a button is so terrible its insulting that they even put that in the game. This is enhanced by the fact that there is vey little guidence in the game, and you have to move to get to the game settings, but the default movement is terrible.

Initially the game seems fun, but then you realize that there are a ton of bugs. Weapons do not hold in your hands correctly and many are difficult to use. The enemies often just flail around like retarted monkeys. And in the end you end up just wacking them in the head with a ax or mace like some kind of human wacka mole game.

Quickly this game becomes repetitive and booring. I will be asking for a refund, while it seems fun at first in the end there is very little replay value , and this is little more than a buggy game with bad graphics and booring play.

review_title: I mean not alot of content but YES
one_reviews_text: Yes, Yes, Yes AND YES
NO, honestly i thought this would have about a 2 hour play time but i was wrong you can play this for as long as you want and i think it is the best game on the oculus store right now!
Excellent game! It doesn't get repetitive because you get new weapons and you battle different bosses throughout the game. I love it!

So happy to see GORN appear on oculus store,
the best melee game out here! be aware of your surroundings though.

review_title: The greatest game in Virtual Reality
one_reviews_text: Forget everything that has come before. This is what VR was created for.

The game seems fun, but the controls need optimizing on the Rift. For example, weapons feel like they were optimized for Vive wands instead of Touch controllers based on the angle of the grip. Also generally, still feels very early access.
This game is fun. No doubt about it, but please make the AI attacks faster. I need a real challenge.

review_title: Great game, but is there beta?
one_reviews_text: So I know there's an experimental beta mode on Steam, but is there any way to download it on Oculus?

review_title: Most fun on VR in a long time
one_reviews_text: This game is more than worth the money. I can't get enough of playing this. It's so funny and fun to play. Best purchase ever

review_title: The best VR game I've ever played.
one_reviews_text: Very immersive, and very fun. It's honestly amazing. I love it and I recommend it to anyone who has a lot of space.
ive only played this game once for about 15 minutes and i can say that experience was awesome
I LOVE IT and i love to fight in game is great for that
Moving around is clanky, do have  a large space to play in too.  Other than that, it's bloody good fun, although it does crash a bit.
review_feedback: Hey, I believe that that crash issue is fixed now, sorry for the inconvenience!

one_reviews_text:
You are Conan.  You pick up a mace.  You see a dude.  You smash that mace into his face.  You look down at his dead body.  You pull off his head and throw it at the other dude coming at you.  The crowd goes nuts.  You murder the other dude with his own weapon that you took out of his hands.

The King asks you to salute him in victory.  You give him the middle finger.  With both hands.

BEST.  GAME.  EVER.
It's fun...
Good game!
Horrible for me, drag to move? Boring game thatr is repetative. AI is simplistic at best. Just crouch and swing and you win. Game is buggy, How do I get refund?
